Text:
Having regained his composure, Goldy Gilded glares
at Shadow and Alpha with a look of frustration.

Don't give us that look. We don't intend on pursuing
your student any further.
What?

I initially thought he had seen something he
shouldn't have. But after hearing him out,
it turns out he hadn't seen anything, so I
let him go.
Then, where did he go?

Now that he's safe, he doesn't need to hide under
your wings forever. He's just a student, after all.
Maybe he went back to school?

...I see. Guess it's no easy feat to find someone who
can step into my shoes.
Just to be clear—I wasn't defeated by the two of you.

Two against one isn't fair. My stomping ground is
the arena, and my fighting style is tailored for
one-on-one battles.
(He's really sore about losing.)

You wouldn't want to be labeled as cowards either,
would you? We'll declare this match a draw and
move on.
...How considerate of you.
(...Who was that sparkly side character anyway?)

(...First, I need to assess the situation. I should
ask Alpha what happened—)
You completely fooled us.
Huh?

You feigned losing your memory to gauge the
Shadow Garden's organizational strength,
didn't you?

To see if we would function properly without you.
To test if we could handle unexpected situations.
And also...

You wanted to remind us, the Seven Shadows...of the
strain and nerves we felt before being assigned to
commanding positions, didn't you?
(That's an...unexpected interpretation!)
Alpha's gaze pierces straight into Shadow.

(It's too late to claim I just lost my memory...
Alpha probably won't buy that... Okay, I'll play
along with her interpretation.)

...Precisely. I'm impressed you've seen through it.
And you faced my trials admirably... You've passed.

I really should have seen through it sooner. I still
have a lot of learning to do.

We should inform the others as well. You're planning
to meet with them now, aren't you?
Yeah. It's time for answers...

Shadow nods. The next moment, the two silently
disappear from the night forest.

Cid stands at the clock tower at night. The Seven
Shadows are behind him.

...So, that's how it is. That's a summary of the
events and Master Shadow's intentions.

Boss, you won't be leaving again, will you? Are you
back for good?

Yes, the charade is over. I trust our future
objectives are now more clear.

If you're feeling complacent, you'd best snap out of
it. We are the Shadow Garden... We lurk in the
darkness and hunt down shadows.

Yes, I'll keep doing my best to contribute to your
power, my lord—
...Huh? Wait, does that mean...
I'll hunt a lot, too! Awwoooo!
I look forward to plenty of your...Shadow Wisdom.

Each in their own way, the members of the Seven
Shadows reaffirm their loyalty to Shadow and the
Shadow Garden.

Our resolve has been strengthened, and we have been
able to express our commitment. That was quite the
wake-up call.

Is this the outcome you wanted Our battle against the
Cult is only going to intensify. Did you want us to
get back to the basics?
Heh... The path we're on is fraught with challenges.

...As Shadow's wise words sink in, Alpha, Eta, and
Delta break into relieved smiles. Meanwhile,
however...
...The memory loss...was a lie...

So, you were aware of my intentions then, Master
Shadow... Aahhh...!!!

Eeeeeep!!! A passionate bond?! What the heck was I
thinking?!

...My lord, so you saw through everything...
Ngh... What was I thinking...?!

N-No way... You remember everything I said...about
us being like l-l-l-lovers on a date...?!

As the four recall their words, actions, and attempts
to manipulate Cid during his memory loss, they squirm
in embarrassment.
